key_channel_insights.line_content: 84.47% of itineraries were priced higher on OTAs than Malaysia Airlines’ website last week, indicating sustained markup pressure.
97.1% of itineraries on metasearch engines offered lower fares than Malaysia Airlines’ website, underscoring MSE’s competitive positioning.
95.7% of GDS listings carried fares above the website, reflecting a steady +0.09% average premium across itineraries.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 84.47% of itineraries on the OTA channel were priced above Malaysia Airlines’ website in the latest week, underscoring a persistent markup trend.
The week-over-week frequency of OTA higher fares declined by 1.32 pp, while the average price premium narrowed from +0.15% to +0.09%.
Far-out bookings carry the highest OTA premium at +0.12%, compared with a more moderate +0.07% for close-in purchases.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 13.47% of itineraries were not available on OTA last week, up 1.20 pp week-over-week and 0.28 pp month-on-month.
Only 1.94% of itineraries matched website fares, remaining flat week-over-week and month-on-month.
84.47% of itineraries exhibited higher OTA fares last week, with the average markup at +0.09%, down from +0.15% the prior week.
A mere 0.11% of itineraries were cheaper on OTA, reflecting a flat trend and an average discount of –0.09%.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes saw 84.19% of fares higher on OTA with an average premium of +0.09%, down 1.06 pp week-over-week.
Long-haul itineraries registered a 96.97% rate of OTA higher fares, carrying a +0.05% average premium, though frequency fell 3.03 pp from the prior week.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Domestic itineraries recorded a 93.06% incidence of higher OTA fares and maintained a +0.09% average markup.
Non-MY origins had 16.84% of fares higher on OTA, 83.16% not listed, and a modest +0.05% average premium.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in purchases showed an 80.69% likelihood of higher OTA fares with a +0.07% average premium.
Far-out bookings exhibited a 91.10% rate of higher OTA fares and the highest average markup at +0.12%.

mse_highlights.line_content: In the latest week MSE offered lower fares on 97.1% of itineraries, reflecting a dominant positioning compared to the airline website.
The proportion of lower-priced listings on MSE climbed by 9.4 percentage points week-over-week, indicating growing competitiveness.
MSE higher-price occurrences remain negligible at 0.0% last week, while the average discount on lower fares held steady at around –0.20%.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: No itineraries were missing on MSE in the latest week, maintaining full distribution coverage.
Same-price listings dropped to 2.9% last week, down 9.2 points week-over-week and 6.2 points month-over-month.
MSE higher-price listings remained at 0.0% frequency, slightly below prior-week levels and unchanged from the month trend.
Lower-price listings accounted for 97.1% of all fares last week, up from 87.7% the week before and 90.2% month-to-date.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul lower-fare share rose to 97.0% last week, up 9.7 points week-over-week, with an average –0.20% price gap.
Long-haul segments saw 100% lower-price listings last week, up 3.0 points week-over-week, sustaining a –0.20% average discount.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Malaysia origin itineraries showed 97.6% lower-price listings last week (+6.7 points week-over-week) and an average –0.21% price difference.
Non-Malaysia itineraries saw lower-price share jump to 92.7% last week, a 31.0-point week-over-week rise, delivering a –0.13% average fare advantage.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings had 97.8% lower-price listings last week, up 12.3 points week-over-week, with an average –0.24% price gap.
Far-out bookings maintained 96.0% lower-price share last week, up 4.6 points week-over-week, at an average –0.14% discount.

gds_highlights.line_content: In the latest week GDS fares exceeded website rates on 95.7% of itineraries, carrying a modest +0.09% average premium.
Only 1.3% of GDS fares were lower than the website last week, though this share rose by 0.69 points versus the prior week with an average –0.14% discount.
Price parity (SAME status) held steady at 2.4% of offerings last week, with zero average difference from the website rate.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Fare offers were unavailable in GDS for 0.69% of itineraries last week, down 0.22 points week-over-week and 0.82 points month-over-month.
SAME-status itineraries comprised 2.40% of GDS listings, flat versus the prior week and delivering zero price variance.
GDS HIGHER frequency stood at 95.66% last week, dipping 0.48 points versus prior week but up 0.86 points month-over-month, with prices +0.09% above website levels.
GDS LOWER bookings represented 1.26% of listings last week, rising 0.69 points week-over-week, with an average –0.14% price advantage.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes saw 95.72% GDS HIGHER share last week (avg +0.09% premium), down 0.38 points week-over-week but up 0.78 points month-over-month.
Long-haul listings showed 94.12% GDS HIGHER share last week (avg +0.11% premium), down 5.88 points versus prior week; GDS LOWER jumped to 5.88%.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Malaysia-origin itineraries posted a 96.28% GDS HIGHER rate last week (+0.09% avg premium), improving 0.09 points week-over-week and 0.94 points month-over-month.
Non-Malaysia origins had 89.69% GDS HIGHER share last week, down 6.05 points week-over-week, while GDS LOWER surged to 8.25% (up 5.06 points).

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings recorded 93.62% GDS HIGHER share last week (avg +0.07% premium), slipping 1.13 points week-over-week but rising 0.41 points month-over-month.
Far-out bookings exhibited 99.08% GDS HIGHER frequency last week with an average +0.12% premium, up 0.30 points week-over-week and 1.88 points month-over-month.
